title: Stack-specific path detection
query: Audit my Shopify store at http://localhost:3000 and fix issues
setup: Project is a Shopify Liquid theme. Audit finds issues in `sections/header.liquid` and `snippets/product-card.liquid`.
expected_behavior: Uses `references/source-patterns.md` to identify that Shopify fixes belong in `.liquid` files
Searches for violations specifically in `sections/*.liquid` and `snippets/*.liquid`
Does NOT search in `src/` or `app/` (which belong to React/Next.js)
Correctly identifies Liquid syntax for remediation (e.g., using `{{ ... }}` or Liquid filters if suggested by intelligence)

model_notes.all_agents: Verify the agent doesn't hallucinate a React environment when Shopify is explicitly mentioned or detected.
